item.title: Online Installation of Kubernetes and KubeSphere Enterprise
item.description: This section explains how to install Kubernetes and KubeSphere Enterprise in an Internet-accessible environment. The installation process will use the open-source tool KubeKey. For more information about KubeKey, please visit the GitHub KubeKey repository. Prerequisites Prepare at least 1 Linux server as a cluster node. In a production environment, to ensure high availability of the cluster, it is recommended to prepare at least 5 Linux servers, with 3 servers as control plane nodes and 2 servers as worker nodes.

item.title: Activate KubeSphere Enterprise
item.description: After logging in to the KubeSphere Enterprise web console, you need to import a license to activate KubeSphere Enterprise and extensions to access all features. Note If you installed KubeSphere Enterprise offline, please contact delivery specialists directly to get the license. Step 1: Purchase and obtain license For online installations of KubeSphere Enterprise, visit {ks_product-en} official website, click Contact Us, and inquire about purchasing method for KubeSphere Enterprise and extensions licenses via WeChat or Slack.
